--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@m...> wrote:
> public void <=
T> assertThat (T obj, Constraint<T> constraint);

Minor nit: you might be a=
ble to relax the signature thusly:

public void <T> assertThat( T target, C=
onstraint<? super T> constraint )

e.g. if type T gets inferred as java.lan=
g.Integer, there's no reason
why the constraint should not be allowed to be=
 of type, say,
Constraint<Number>.

cheers,
